metadata.title: CVE-2021-22924 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
libcurl keeps previously used connections in a connection pool for subsequenttransfers to reuse, if one of them matches the setup.Due to errors in the logic, the config matching function did not take 'issuercert' into account and it compared the involved paths *case insensitively*,which could lead to libcurl reusing wrong connections.File paths are, or can be, case sensitive on many systems but not all, and caneven vary depending on used file systems.The comparison also didn't include the 'issuer cert' which a transfer can setto qualify how to verify the server certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.74.0-1.2ubuntu4
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.74.0-1.2ubuntu4
libcurl3-nss - 7.74.0-1.2ubuntu4
libcurl4 - 7.74.0-1.2ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> introduced in 7.10.4 rodrigo-zaiden> although the issue was introduced in 7.10.4, versions earlier than 7.52.0 would need at least parts of commit cb4e2be7 so the fix for this CVE can be applied. this change seems quite intrusive and there is a high risk of regressions. hence, versions earlier than 7.52 will be ignored.

criterions.comment: curl package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.74.0-1.2ubuntu4').
